hindN\, wataquwmu hindN\, waqaAmato {lohindaAni\, wataquwmu {lohindaAni\, waqaAmati {lohindaAtu\, wataquwmu {lohindaAtu\, waqaAmati {lohunuwdu\, wataquwmu {lohunuwdu\, waqaAma >axuwka\, wayaquwmu >axuwka\, waqaAma gulaAmiY\, wayaquwmu gulaAmiY\, wamaA >a$obaha *alika\. wa{lmuDomaru {vonaA Ea$ara\, naHowa qawolika\: Darabotu\, waDarabonaA\, waDarabota\, waDaraboti\, waDarabotumaA\, waDarabotumo\, waDarabotun~a\, waDaraba\, waDarabato\, waDarabaA\, waDarabuwA@\, waDarabona\. baAbu {lomafoEuwli {l~a*iY lamo yusam~a faAEiluhu wahuwa\: {li{somu {lomarofuwEu {l~a*iY lamo yu*okaro maEahu faAEiluhu\. fa<in kaAna {lofiEolu maADiyFA Dum~a >aw~aluhu wakusira maA qabola 'aAxirihi\, wa<in kaAna muDaAriEFA Dum~a >aw~aluhu wafutiHa maA qabola 'aAxirihi\.

wa{lomubotada>u qisomaAni\: ZaAhirN\, wamuDomarN\. fa{lZ~aAhiru\: maA taqad~ama *ikoruhu\. wa{lmuDomaru {vonaA Ea$ara\, wahiYa\: >anaA\, wanaHonu\, wa>anota\, wa>anoti\, wa>anotumaA\, wa>anotumo\, wa>anotun~a\, wahuwa\, wahiYa\, wahumaA\, wahumo\, wahun~a\, naHowa qawolika\: >anaA qaA^}imN\, wanaHonu qaA^}imuwona\, wamaA >a$obaha *alika\. wa{loxabaru qisomaAni\: muforadN\, wagayoru muforadK\. fa{lomuforadu naHowa\: zayodN qaA^}imN\. wagayoru {lmuforadi\, >arobaEapu >a$oyaA^'K\: {lojaAr~u wa{lomajoruwru\, wa{lZ~arofu\, wa{lofiEolu maEa faAEilihi\, wa{lomubotada>u maEa xabarihi\, naHowa qawolika\: zayodN fiY {ld~aAri\, wazayodN Eindaka\, wazayodN qaAma >abuwhu\, wazayodN jaAriyatuhu *aAhibahN\.

baAbu {loEawaAmili {ld~aAxilapi EalaY {lomubotada<i wa{loxabari wahiYa valAavapu >a$oyaA^'a\: kaAna wa>axowaAtuhaA\, wa<in~a wa>axowaAtuhaA\, waZanantu wa>axowaAtuhaA\. fa>am~aA kaAna wa>axowaAtuhaA\, fa<in~ahaA tarofaEu {li{soma\, watanSibu {loxabara\, wahiYa\: kaAna\, wa>amosaY\, wa>aSobaHa\, wa>aDoHaY\, waZal~a\, wabaAta\, waSaAra\, walayosa\, wamaA zaAla\, wamaA {nofak~a\, wamaA fati}a\, wamaA bariHa\, wamaA daAma\, wamaA taSar~afa minhaA naHowa\: kaAna\, wayakuwnu\, wakun\, wa>aSobaHa wayuSobiHu wa>aSobiH\, taquwlu (kaAna zayodN qaA^}imFA\, walayosa EamorNw $aAxiSFA) wamaA >a$obaha *alika\. wa>am~aA <in~a wa>axowaAtuhaA\, fa<inah~aA tanSibu {li{soma watarofaEu {loxabara\, wahiYa\: <in~a\, wa>an~a\, walakin~a\, waka>an~a\, walayota\, walaE~ala\, taquwlu\: <in~a zayodFA qaA^}imN\, walayota EamorFA $aAxiSN\,

wamaA >a$obaha *alika\, wamaEonaY <in~a wa>an~a lilt~awokiydi\, walakin~a lili{sotidoraAki\, waka>an~a lilt~a$obiyhi\, walayota lilt~aman~aY\, walaE~ala lilt~aroj~iY wa{lt~awaquEi\. wa>am~aA Zananotu wa>axowaAtuhaA fa<in~ahaA tanSibu {lomubotada>a wa{loxabara EalaY >an~ahumaA mafoEuwlaAni lahaA\, wahiYa\: Zananotu\, waHasibotu\, waxilotu\, wazaEamotu\, wara>ayotu\, waEalimotu\, wawajadotu\, wa{t~axa*otu\, wajaEalotu\, wasamiEotu\; taquwlu\: Zanantu zayodFA munTaliqFA\, waxilotu EamorFA $aAxiSFA\, wamaA >a$obaha *alika\. baAbu {ln~aEoti {ln~aEotu taAbiEN lilomanEuwti fiY rafoEihi wanaSobihi waxafoDihi\, wataEoriyfihi watankiyrihi\; taquwlu qaAma zayodN {loEaAqilu\, wara>ayotu zayodFA {loEaAqila\, wamararotu bizayodK {loEaAqili\.

wa{lomaEorifapu xamosapu >a$oyaA^'a\: {li{somu {lomuDomaru naHowa >anaA wa>anota\, wa{li{somu {loEalamu naHowu\: zayodN wamak~apu\, wa{li{somu {lomubohamu naHowu\: ha*aA\, waha*ihi\, waha&ulaA^'i\, wa{li{somu {l~a*iY fiyhi {lo>alifu wa{ll~aAmu naHowa {lr~ajulu wa{logulaAmu\, wamaA >uDiyfa <ilaY waAHidK min ha*ihi {lo>arobaEapi\. wa{ln~akirapu\, kul~u {somK $aA^}iEK fiY jinsihi laA yaxotaS~u bihi waAHidN duwna 'aAxara\, wataqoriybuhu kul~u maA SalaHa duxuwlu {lo>alifi wa{ll~aAmi Ealayohi\, naHowu\: {lr~ajulu\, wa{lfarasu\. baAbu {loEaTofi waHuruwfu {loEaTofi Ea$arapN\, wahiYa\: {lowaAwu\, wa{lofaA^'u\, wavum~a\, wa>awo\, wa>amo\, wa<im~aA\, wabalo\, walaA\, walakin\, waHat~aY fiY baEoDi {lomawaADiEi\.

fa<in EaTafato bihaA EalaY marofuwEK rafaEato\, >awo EalaY manSuwbK naSabato\, >awo EalaY maxofuwDK xafaDato\, >awo EalaY majozuwmK jazamato\, taquwlu\: (qaAma zayodN waEamorNw\, wara>ayotu zayodFA waEamorFA\, wamararotu bizayodK waEamorKw\, wazayodN lamo yaqumo walamo yaqoEudo)\. baAbu {lt~awokiydi {lt~awokiydu taAbiEN lilomu&ak~adi fiY rafoEihi wanaSobihi waxafoDihi wataEoriyfihi\. wayakuwnu bi>alofaAZK maEoluwmapK\, wahiYa\: {ln~afosu\, wa{loEayonu\, wakul~u\, wa>ajomaEu\, watawaAbiEu >ajomaEa\, wahiYa >akotaEu\, wa>abotaEu\, wa>aboSaEu\, taquwlu\: qaAma zayodN nafosuhu\, wara>ayotu {loqawoma kul~ahumo\, wamararotu bi{loqawomi >ajomaEiyna\.

baAbu {lomafoEuwli maEahu wahuwa {li{somu {lomanSuwbu\, {l~a*iY yu*okaru libayaAni mano fuEila maEahu {lofiEolu\, naHowa qawolika\: (jaA^'a {lo>amiyru wa{lojayo$a) wa ({sotawaY {lamaA^'u wa{loxa$abapa)\. wa>amaA xabaru (kaAna) wa>axowaAtihaA\, wa{somu (<in~a) wa>axowaAtihaA\, faqado taqa~damo *ikoruhumaA fiY {lomarofuwEaAti\, waka*alika {lt~awaAbiEu\; faqado taqa~damato hunAaka\. baAbu {lomaxofuwDaAti mina {lo>asomaA^'i {lomaxofuwDaAtu valaAavpu >anowaAEK\: maxofuwDN bi{loHarofi\, wamaxofuwDN bi{lo<iDaAfapi\, wataAbiEN lilomaxofuwDi\. fa>am~aA {lomaxofuwDu bi{loHarofi fahuwa maA yuxofaSu bimino\, wa<ilaY\, waEan\, waEalaY\, wafiY\, warub~a\, wa{lobaA^'i\, wa{lokaAfi\,

fa<in kaAna yarafoEu bi{lD~am~api fa<in~ahu yuboniY EalaY {lD~am~api\, naHowN (ya`muHam~adu) wa (ya`faATimapu) wa (ya`rajulu) wa (ya`faATimaAtu) wa<in kaAna yarofaEu bi{lo>alifi niyaAbapF Eani {lD~am~api \- wa*alika {lomuvnaY \- fa<in~ahu yuboniY EalaY {lo>alifi\, naHowN (ya`muHam~adaAni) wa (ya`faATimataAni) wa<in kaAna yurofaEu bi{lowaAwi niyaAbapF Eani {lD~am~api \- wa*alika jamoEu {lomu*akiri {ls~aAlimi \- fa<in~hu yuboniY EalaY {lowaAwi naHowN (ya`muHam~aduwna)\. wa<i*aA kaAna {lomunaAdaY nakirapK gayori maqoSuwdapK >awo muDaAfFA >awo $abiyhFA bi{lomuDaAfi fa<in~ahu yanSabu bi{lofatoHapi >awo maA naAbK EanhaA naHowN (ya`jaAhilFA taEal~amo) wa (ya`kasuwlFA >aqobalu EalaY maA yanfaEuka) wanaHowN (ya`raAgiba {lomajidi {Eomalo lahu) wa (ya`muHib~a {lr~ifoEapi vaAbiro EalaY {ls~aEoYi) wanaHowN (ya`raAgibFA fiY {ls~u&odudi laA taDojaro mina {loEamali) wa (ya`HariySFA EalaY {loxayori {sotiqamo)\. >aso_#ilapN maA huwa {lomunaAdaY lugapF wa{SoTilaAHFA? maA hiYa >adowaAtu {ln~idaA^'i? mav~il likul~i >adaApK bimivaAlK\, <ilaY kamo qisomN yanqasimu {lomunaAdaY? maA huwa {lomuforadu wamav~il lahu bimivaAlayoni muxotalifayni\, maA hiYa {ln~akirapu {lomaqoSuwdapu maEa {lt~amoviyli? maA huwa {l$~abiyhu bi{lomuDaAfi? <ilaY kamo nawoEN yatonawEu {l$~abiyha bi{lomuDaAfi maEa {lotamoviyli likul~i nawoEK? maA Hukomu {lomunaAdaY {lomuforadi? maA Hukomu {lomunaAdaY {lomuDaAfi? mav~ilo likul~i nawoEK min >anwaAEi {lomunaAdaY {loxamosapi bimivaAlayni\, wa>aEoribo waAHidFA minhumaA\.

{lomafoEuwlu lahu qaAla\: (baAbu {lomafoEuwli min >ajolihi) wahuwa\: {li{somu\, {lomanSuwbu\, ya*okuru bayaAnFA lisababi wuquwEi {lofiEoli\, naHowu qawolika\: (qaAma zayodN <ijolaAlFA liEamori) wa (qaSadotuka {botigaA^'a maEoruwfika)\. wa>aquwlu\: {lomafoEuwlu min >ajolihi \- wayuqaAlu ({lomafoEuwlu li>ajolihi)\, wa ({lomafoEuwlu lahu) \- huwa fiY {SoTilaAHi {ln~aHaApi EibaArapK Ean ({li{somu\, {lomanSuwbu\, {l~a*iY ya*okuru bayaAnFA lisababi wuquwEi {lofiEoli)\. waqawolunaA\: ({li{somu) ya$omilu {lS~ariyHu wa{lomu&aw~alu bihi\. walaAbud~a fiY {li{somi {l~a*iY yaqiEu mafoEuwlFA lahu min >an yajotamiEu fiyhi xamosapi >umuwrK\: {lo>aw~alu\: >an yakuwnu maSodarFA\. wa{lv~aAniY~u\: >an yakuwnu qulobiy~FA\, wamaEonaY kawonihi qulobiy~FA >alaA yakuwnu daAl~FA EalaY EamalK min >aEomaAli {lojawaAriHi ka{loyad~i wa{ll~isaAni mivolN (qaraA^'apN) wa (DarobN)\. wa{lv~aAlivu\: >an yakuwnu Eil~apF limaA qabolahu\. wa{lr~aAbiEu\: >an yakuwnu mut~aHidFA maEa EaAmalihi fiY {lowaqoti\. waxaAmisu\: >an yat~aHidu maEa EaAmalihi fiY {lofaAEili\. wamivaAlu {li{somi {lomusotajamiEi liha*ihi {l$~uruwTi (ta>odiybFA) min qawolika\: (Darabotu {boniY ta>odiybFA) fa<in~ahu maSodarN\, wahuwa qulobiy~N\; li>an~ahu layosa min >aEomaAli {lojawaAriHi\, wahuwa Eil~apN lilD~arobi\, wahuwa mut~aHidN maEa (Darabotu) fiY {lz~amaAni\, wafiY {lofaAEili >ayoDFA\. wakul~u {somK {sotawafiY ha*ihi {l$~uruwTi yajuwzu fiyhi >amoraAnN\: {ln~aSobu\, wa{lojar~u biHarofK min Huruwfi {loj~ar~i {ld~aAlapi EalaY {lt~aEoliyli ka{ll~aAmi\. wa{Eolamo >an lili{somi {l~a*iY yaqiEu mafoEuwlFA li>ajolihi valaAvi HaAlaAtK\: {lo>uw~laY\: >an yakuwnu muqotarinFA bi>al\. {lv~aAniyapu\: >an yakuwnu muDaAfFA\. {lv~aAlavapu\: >an yakuwnu mujoradFA min (>al) wamina {lo<iDaAfapi\. wafiY jamiyEi ha*ihi {lo>aHowaAli yajuwzu fiyhi {ln~aSobu wa{lojar~u biHarofi {lojar~i\, <il~aA >an~ahu qado yatorajiHu >aHada {lowajihayoni\, waqado yasotawiyaAni fiY {lojawaAzi\. fa<in kaAna muqotarinFA bi>al fa{lo>akovaru fiyhi >an yujar~a daAl~K EalaY {lt~aEoliyli\, naHowN\: (Darabotu {boniY lilt~a>adiybi) wayaqul~u naSobuhu\. wa<in kaAna muDaAfFA jaAza jawaAzFA mutasaAwiyFA >an yujar~a bi{loHarofi wa>in yanSabu\, naHowN\: (zarotuka maH~abapa >adabika) >awo (zarotuka limaHab~api >adabika)\. wa<in kaAna majorudFA min (>al) wamin {lo<iDaAfapi fa{lo>akovaru fiyhi >an yanSabu\, naHowN\: (qamotu <ijolaAlFA lilo>ustaA*i) wayaqul~u jar~ihi bi{loHarofi\, wa{ll~ahu >aEolamu\. >aso_#ilapN maA huwa {lomafoEuwlu li>ajolihi? maA {l~a*iY ya$otariTu fiY {li{somi {l~a*iY yaqiEu mafoEuwlFA li>ajolihi? kamo HaAlapF lili{somi {lowaAqiEi mafoEuwlFA lahu? maA Hukomu {lomafoEuwli lahu {lomuqotarinu bi>alo wa{lomuDaAfu? mav~ilo bivalaAvapi >amovalapK lilomafoEuwli li>ajolihi bi$aroTK >an yakuwnu {lo>aw~alu muqotarinFA bi>alo wa{lv~aAniY~u muDaAfFA wa{lv~aAlivu mujoradFA min >alo wa{lo<iDaAfapi\, wa>aEoribo kul~a waAHidK minhaA\, wabay~ino fiY kul~i mivaAlK maA yajuwzu fiyhi mina {lowujuwhi maEa bayaAna {lo>arojaHi <in kaAna\.

{lomafoEuwlu maEahu qaAla\: (baAbu {lomafoEuwli maEahu) wahuwa\: {li{somu\, {lomanSuwbu\, {l~a*iY yu*okaru libayaAni min fuEila maEahu {lofiEolu\, naHowN qawolika\: (jaA^'a {lo>amiyru wa{lojayo$a) wa ({sotawaY {lomaA^'u wa{loxa$abapa)\. wa>aquwlu\: {lomafoEuwlu maEahu Einda {ln~aHaApi huwa\: ({li{somu\, {lofaDilapu\, {lomanSuwbu bi{lofiEoli >awo maA fiyhi maEonaY {lofiEoli waHuruwfihi\, {ld~Al~u EalaY {l*~aAti {l~atiY waqiEa {lofiEolu bimuSaAHibatihaA\, {lomasobuwqu biwaAwK tufiydu {lomaEiy~apa naSFA)\. faqawolunaA\: ({li{somu) ya$omalu {lomuforadu wa{lomuvonaY wa{lojamoEu\, wa{lomu*akiru wa{lomu&anivu wa{lomuraAdu bihi\: {li{somu {lS~ariyHu duwna {lomu&aw~ali\, waxaraja Eanhu {lofiEolu wa{loHarofu wa{lojumolapu\. waqawolunaA\: ({lofaDilapu) maEnaAhu >an~ahu layosa rukonFA fiY {lokalaAmi\; falayosa faAEilFA\, walaA mubotada>N walaA xabarFA\, waxaraja bihi {loEimadapu\, naHowN ({$otarika zayodN waEamorN)\. waqawolunaA\: ({lomanSuwbu bi{lofiEoli >awo maA fiyhi maEonaY {lofiEoli waHuruwfihi) yadul~u EalaY >ani {loEaAmili fiY {lomafoEuwli maEahu EalaY Darabayoni\: {lo>aw~alu\: {lofiEolu\, naHowN (HaDara {lo>amiyru wa{lojayo$a)\. {lv~aAniY~u\: {li{somu {ld~aAl~u EalaY maEonaY {lofiEoli {lomu$otamili EalaY Huruwfihi\, ka{somi {lofaAEili fiY naHowN ({lo>amiyru HaADirN wa{lojayo$a)\. waqawolunaA\: ({lomasobuwqu biwaAwK hiYa naSN fiY {ld~alaAlapi EalaY {lomaEiyapi) yaxoruju bihi {li{somu {lomasobuwqu biwaAwK layosato naSFA fiY {ld~alaAlapi EalaY {lomaEiyapi\, naHowN (HaDara muHam~adN waxaAlidN)\. wa{Eolamo >ani {li{somu {lowaAqiEu baEoda {lowaAwi EalaY nawoEayoni\: 1\- maA yatoEay~anu naSobuhu EalaY >an~ahu mafoEuwlN maEahu\. 2\- maA yajuwzu naSobuhu EalaY *alika wa{tobaAEuhu limaA qabolihi fiY <iEoraAbihi maEoTuwfFA Ealayohi\. >amaA {ln~awoEu {lo>aw~alu famaHoluhu <i*aA lamo yaSiH~a ta$oriyku maA baEoda {lowaAwi limaA qabolihaA fiY {loHukomi\, naHowN (>anaA saA^}irN wa{lojibala) wanaHowN (*aAkarotu wa{lomiSobaAHa) fa<in~a {lojibala laA yaSaH~u ta$oriykuhu lilomutakal~imi fiY {ls~ayori\, waka*alika {lomiSobaAHu laA yaSaH~u ta$oriykuhu lilomutakal~imi fiY {lomu*aAkirapi\, waqado mav~ala {lomu&alifu liha*aA {ln~awoEi biqawolihi\: ({sotawaY {lomaA^'u wa{loxa$abapa)\. wa>amaA {lv~aAniY~u famaHoluhu <i*aA SaH~a ta$oriyku maA baEoda {lowaAwi limaA qabolihaA fiY {loHukomi\, naHowN (HaDara EaliY~N wamuHam~adN) fa<in~ahu yajuwzu naSoba (muHam~adN) EalaY >an~ahu mafoEuwlN maEahu\, wayajuwzu rafoEahu EalaY >an~ahu maEoTuwfN EalaY (EaliY~N)\; li>an~a muHam~adFA yajuwzu {$otiraAkahu maEa EaliY~K fiY {loHaDuwri\, waqado mav~ala {lomu&alifi liha*aA {ln~awoEi biqawolihi\: (jaA^'a {lo>amiyru wa{lojayo$a)\. >aso_#ilapN maA huwa {lomafoEuwlu maEahu? maA {lomuraAdu bi{li{somi hunaA? maA {lomuraAdu bi{lofaDolapi? maA {l~a*iY yaEomalu fiY {lomafoEuwli maEahu? <ilaY kamo qisomN yanqasimu {lomafoEuwla maEahu? mav~ilo lilomafoEuwli maEahu {l~a*iY yajibu naSobuhu bimivaAlayoni\, mav~ilo lilomafoEuwli maEahu {l~a*iY yajuwzu naSobuhu wa{tobaAEuhu limaA qabolihi bimivaAlayoni\, >aEoribi {lomivaAlayoni {ll~a*ayoni fiY kalaAmi {lomu&alifi\, wabay~in fiY kul~i mivaAlK minhumaA min >ay~i nawoEK huwa\. qaAla\: wa>amaA xabaru (kaAna) wa>axowaAtihaA wa{somu (<in~a) wa>axowaAtihaA faqado taqad~ama *ikoruhumaA fiY {lomarofuwEaAti\, waka*alika {lt~awaAbiEu\; {lomaxofuwDaAtu mina {lo>asomaA^'i qaAla\: (baAbu {lomaxofuwDaAti mina {lo>asomaA^'i) {lomaxofuwDaAtu valaAvapu >anwaAEK\, maxofuwDN bi{loHarofi\, wamaxofuwDN bi{lo<iDaAfapi\, wataAbiEN lilomaxofuwDi\. wa>aquwlu\: {li{somu {lomaxofuwDi EalaY valaAvapi >anwaAEK\; wa*alika li>an~a {loxaAfoDi lahu <imaA >an yakuwnu HarofFA\, min Huruwfi {loxafoDi {l~atiY sabaqa bayaAnuhaA\, fiY >aw~ali {lokitaAbi wa{l~atiY saya*okuruhaA {lomu&alifu baEoda *alika\, wa*alika naHowN (xaAlidK) min qawlika\: (>a$ofaqotu EalaY xaAlidK) fa<in~ahu majoruwrN biEalaY\, wahuwa HarofN min Huruwfi {loxafoDi\, wa<imaA >an yakuwnu {loxaAfoDu lili{somi <iDaAfapi {somK qaboluhu <ilayohi\, wamaEonaY {lo<iDaAfapi\: nisobapu {lv~aAniY~i lilo>aw~ali\, wa*alika naHowN (muHam~adN) min qawolika\: (jaA^'a gulaAmu muHam~adK) fa<in~ahu maxofuwDN bisababi <iDaAfapi (gulaAmu) <ilayohi\, wa<imaA >an yakuwnu {loxaAfoDu lili{somi tabEiy~atuhu li{somK maxofuwDK\: bi>an yakuwnu naEotFA lahu\, naHowN ({lofaADilu) min qawolika\: (>axa*otu {loEiloma Ean muHam~adK {lofaADili) >awo maEoTuwfFA Ealayohi\, naHowN (xaAlidK) min qawolika\: (mararotu bimuHam~adK waxaAlidK) >aw gayoru ha*ayoni mina {lt~awaAbiEi {l~atiY sabaqa *ikoruhaA\.

\{phrase:WhenWakingUp2\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/39, among others. The wording here is from Ibn Majah 2/335.\}
\{phrase:WhenWearingAGarment1\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari, Muslim, Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmithi. See also 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 7/47.\}
\{phrase:WhenWearingANewGarment1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud and At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Mukhtasar Shamd'il At-Tirmithi, p. 47.\}
\{phrase:WhenSomeoneElseWearingANewGarment1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/41. See also Al-Albani Sahih Abu Dawud 2/760.\}
\{phrase:WhenSomeoneElseWearingANewGarment2\}\{reference:Ibn Majah 2/1178, Al-Baghawi 12/41. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/275.\}
\{phrase:InTheNameOfAllah\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 2/505, among others. See 'Irwa'ul Ghalil no. 49 and Sahihul-Jami' 3/203.\}

(\{phrase:InTheNameOfAllah\}) \{phrase:BeforeEnteringTheToilet1\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari 1/45, Muslim 1/283. The addition of Bismillah at its beginning was reported by Said bin Mansur. See Fathul-Bari 1/244.\}
\{phrase:AfterLeavingTheToilet1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmithi. An-Nasa'i recorded it in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah. Also see the checking of Ibn Al-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad, 2/387.\}
\{phrase:InTheNameOfAllah\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, and Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, 'Irwa'ul-Ghain 1/122.\}
\{phrase:UponCompletingAblution2\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 1/78. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At- Tirmithi 1/18.\}
\{phrase:ForExpiationOfSinsAtTheConclusionOfSittingOrGathering1\}\{reference:An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, p. 173. See also Al-Albani, 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 1/135 and 2/94.\}
\{phrase:WhenLeavingTheHome1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/325, At-Tirmithi 5/490. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/151.\}
\{phrase:WhenLeavingTheHome2\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/336.\}

\{phrase:UponEnteringTheHome1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/325. Muslim (Hadith no. 2018) says that one should mention the Name of Allah when entering the home and when beginning to eat; and that the devil, hearing this, says: "There is no shelter for us here tonight and no food."\}

\{phrase:WhenGoingToTheMosque1\} \{reference:Al-Bukhari 11/116 (Hadith no. 6316) and by Muslim 1/526,529-530 (Hadith no. 763). Al-Tirmidhi 5/483 (Hadith no. 3419). Al-Bukhari in Al-Adab Al-Mufrad (Hadith no. 695), p. 258. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Al-Adab Al-Mufrad (no. 536), Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/118.\}

\{phrase:UponEnteringTheMosque1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud and Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jdmi' As-Saghir (Hadithno. 4591). Ibn As-Sunni (Hadith no. 88), graded good by Al-Albani. Abu Dawud 1/126, see also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami'As-Saghir 1/528. Muslim 1/494. There is also a report in Sunan Ibn Majah on the authority of Fatimah (RA), : "O Allah, forgive me my sins and open for me the doors of Your mercy." It was graded authentic by Al-Albani due to supporting Ahadith. See Sahih Ibn Majah 1/128-9.\}
\{phrase:AtTheStartOfPrayer2\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/77 and Sahih Ibn Majah 1/135.\}
\{phrase:AtTheStartOfPrayer5\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 1/203, Ibn Majah 1/265, ai Ahmad 4/85. Muslim recorded a similar Hadith 1/420.\}
\{phrase:AtTheStartOfPrayer6\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/3, 11/116, 13/371, 423, 465. See also Muslim for a shorter account, 1/532.\}
\{phrase:WhileBowingInPrayer1\} (valaAvFA)\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi, and Ahmad. See Al-Albani's Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/83.\}
\{phrase:WhileBowingInPrayer4\}\{reference:Muslim 1/534, Abu Dawud, An-Nasa'i and At- Tirmithi.\}
\{phrase:WhileBowingInPrayer5\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 1/230, An-Nasa'i and Ahmad. Its chain of narration is good (Hasan).\}
\{phrase:WhileProstrating1\} (valaAvFA)\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi, and Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/83.\}
\{phrase:WhileBowingInPrayer2\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari and Muslim, see invocation no. 34 above.\}
\{phrase:WhileProstrating5\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 1/230, An-Nasa'i, Ahmad. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Abu Dawud 1/166, see invocation no. 37 above.\}
\{phrase:BetweenTwoProstrations1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 1/231. See also Al-Albani, Sahihibn Mdjah 1/148.\}
\{phrase:BetweenTwoProstrations2\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/90 and Sahih Ibn Majah 1/148.\}
\{phrase:ProstratingDueToQuranRecitation2\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 2/473, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 1/219.\}
\{phrase:BeforeGivingPeaceOfPrayer1\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari 2/102, Muslim 1/412, and this is Muslim's wording.\}
\{phrase:BeforeGivingPeaceOfPrayer5\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/86, An-Nasa'i 3/53. See also Al-Albani Sahih Abu Dawud 1/284.\}
\{phrase:BeforeGivingPeaceOfPrayer7\}\{reference:Abu Dawud. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/328.\}
\{phrase:BeforeGivingPeaceOfPrayer8\}\{reference:An-Nasa'i 3/54, 55, Ahmad 4/364. See also Al-Albani, Sahih An-Nasa'i 1/281.\}
\{phrase:BeforeGivingPeaceOfPrayer9\}\{reference:An-Nasa'i 3/52, Ahmad 4/338. See also Al-Albani, Sahih An-Nasa'i 1/280 and Sifat Salatun-Nabi, pg. 204.\}
\{phrase:BeforeGivingPeaceOfPrayer10\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, An-Nasa'i, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/329.\}
\{phrase:BeforeGivingPeaceOfPrayer11\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/62, Ibn Majah 2/1267, At-Tirmithi 5/515, Ahmad 5/360. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/329 and Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/163.\}
\{phrase:RemembranceAfterGivingPeaceOfPrayer4\}\{reference:Muslim 1/418, Whoever says this after every prayer will be forgiven his sins even though they be as the foam of the sea.\}
\{112\} (valaAvFA) \{113\} (valaAvFA) \{114\} (valaAvFA)\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/86, An-Nasa'i 3/68. See also Al-Albani, SahihAt-Tirmithi 2/8.\}

\{2:255\}\{reference:An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (Hadith no. 100), also Ibn As-Sunni (no. 121). See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/339 and Silsilatul-Ahadith As-Sahihah 2/697 (no. 972).\}

\{phrase:RemembranceAfterGivingPeaceOfPrayer7\} (Ea$ora mar~aAtFA baEoda {lomagoribu wa{lS~aboHu)\{reference:At-Tirmithi 5/515, Ahmad 4/227. See its checking in Ibn Al-Qayyim Al-Jawziyyah's Zddul-Ma'ad 1/300.\}
\{phrase:RemembranceAfterGivingPeaceOfPrayer8\} (baEoda {ls~alaAmi min Salaw`pi {lofajori)\{reference:Ibn Majah and others. See Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/152 and Majma'uz-Zawd'id 10/111.\}

\{phrase:InTheEvening3\} (>arobaEFA mar~aAtFA Hiyna)\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/317. It was also reported by Al-Bukhari in Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad, An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah and Ibn As-Sunni. Nasa'i's and Abu Dawud's chains of transmission are good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 23.\}

\{phrase:InTheEvening4\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/318, An-Nasa'i 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 7), Ibn As-Sunni (no. 41), Ibn Hibban (no. 2361). Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 24.\}
\{phrase:InTheEvening5\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/322. Its transmission chain is good (Hasan). See also Ibn Al-Qayyim, Zadul- Ma'ad 2/273.\}

\{phrase:InTheEvening7\} (valaAvFA)\{reference:Ahmad 2/290, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah no. 590, At-Tirmithi 3/187, Ibn As-Sunni no. 68. According to Al-Albani, Ibn Majah's (2/266) chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), and following Ibn Baz 45, At-Tirmithi's report is good (Hasan).\}

\{phrase:InTheMorning3\} (>arobaEFA mar~aAtFA Hiyna)\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/317. It was also reported by Al-Bukhari in Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad, An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah and Ibn As-Sunni. Nasa'i's and Abu Dawud's chains of transmission are good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 23.\}

\{phrase:InTheMorning4\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/318, An-Nasa'i 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 7), Ibn As-Sunni (no. 41), Ibn Hibban (no. 2361). Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 24.\}
\{phrase:InTheMorning5\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/322. Its transmission chain is good (Hasan). See also Ibn Al-Qayyim, Zadul- Ma'ad 2/273.\}
\{112\} (valaAvFA) \{113\} (valaAvFA) \{114\} (valaAvFA)\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/322, and At-Tirmithi 5/567. See Al-Albani's Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/182.\}
\{phrase:InTheMorningOrEvening3\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari 7/150. Other reports are in An-Nasa'i and At-Tirmithi.\}

\{phrase:InTheMorningOrEvening4\} (valaAvFA)\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/324, Ahmad 5/42, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no. 22), Ibn As-Sunni (no. 69), Al-Bukhari Al-'Adab Al-Mufrad. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 26.\}

\{9:129:4-17\} (sabaEFA mar~aAtFA Hiyna)\{reference:Ibn As-Sunni (no. 71), Abu Dawud 4/321. Both reports are attributed directly to the Prophet j§ (Marfu1). The chain of transmission is sound (Sahih). Ibn As-Sunni.\}
\{phrase:InTheMorningOrEvening8\} (valaAvFA)\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/323, At-Tirmithi 5/465, Ibn Majah 2/332, Ahmad. Ibn Majah's chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 39.\}

\{phrase:InTheMorningOrEvening9\} (valaAvFA)\{reference:Ahmad 4/337, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 4, Ibn As-Sunni (no. 68), At-Tirmithi 5/465. Its chain of transmission is good (Hasan), Ibn Baz, p. 39.\}
\{phrase:InTheMorningOrEvening10\}\{reference:Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih), Al-Hakim 1/545, see Albani, Sahihut-Targhib wat-Tarhib, 1/273.\}

\{phrase:InTheMorningOrEvening12\} (miA}apu mir~apu)\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/319, 3/957, Ahmad 4/60, Ibn Majah 2/331, Ibn Al-Qayyim Zadul-Ma'ad 2/388. Its chain of transmission is sound (Sahih). Al-Albani 1/270.\}

\{phrase:InTheMorningOrEvening13\} (Ea$arapF)\{reference:At-Tabrani reported this Hadith together with two chain of transmissions. One of them is reliable (Jayyid). See Haithami's Majma' Az-Zawa'id 10/120, and Al-Albani's Sahih At-Targhib Wat-Tarhib 1/273.\}
\{phrase:RemembranceBeforeSleeping6\} (valaAvFA)\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/311. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/143.\}
\{32\}\{67\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi, An-Nasa'i. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami ' As-Saghir 4/255.\}

\{phrase:WhenTurningOverInTheNight1\}\{reference:Al-Hakim graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 1/540. Also see An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, and Ibn As-Sunni. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/213.\}
\{phrase:UponExperiencingFearUnrestApprehensivenessDuringSleep1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/12. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At- Tirmithi 3/171.\}

\{phrase:DesperateOddPrayer1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi, Ahmad, Ad-Darimi, Al-Hakim, and Al-Bayhaqi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/144, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-GhaW. 2/172.\}
\{phrase:DesperateOddPrayer2\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, An-Nasa'i, At-Tirmithi, Ahmad. See Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/180, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/194, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil. 2/175.\}
\{phrase:DesperateOddPrayer3\}\{reference:Al-Bayhaqi graded its chain authentic in As-Sunan Al-Kubra. Al-Albani said in 'Irwa'ul-GhaliL 2/170 that its chain is authentic as a statement of 'Umar.\}

\{87\}\{109\}\{112\} \{phrase:OddPrayerAndAfter1\}\{reference:An-Nasa'i 3/244, Ad-Daraqutni and others. The final addition is from Ad-Daraqutni's version 2/31 and its chain of narration is authentic. See the checking of Zadul-Ma'ad by Shu'aib Al-Arna'ut and 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut 1/337.\}
\{phrase:ForOneInDistress2\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/324, Ahmad 5/42. Al-Albani graded it as good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/959.\}
\{21:87:15-23\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 5/529. Al-Hakim declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/505. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/168.\}
\{phrase:ForOneInDistress4\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/87. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Mdjah 2/335.\}
\{phrase:UponEncounteringAnEnemyOrThoseOfAuthority1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/89, and Al-Hakim graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 2/142.\}
\{phrase:UponEncounteringAnEnemyOrThoseOfAuthority2\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 3/42, At-Tirmithi 5/572. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/183.\}
\{57:3\}\{reference:Al-Hadid 57:3, Abu Dawud 4/329. Al-Albani graded it good in SahihAbu Dawud, 3/962.\}

\{phrase:ForOneWhoseAffairsHaveBecomeDifficult1\}\{reference:Ibn Hibban in his Sahih (no. 2427), and Ibn As- Sunni (no. 351). Al-Hafidh (Ibn Hajar) said that this Hadith is authentic. It was also declared authentic by 'Abdul-Qadir Al-Arna'ut in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-Athkarp. p106.\}
\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/86, At-Tirmithi 2/257. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/283.\}
\{phrase:SeekRefugeWithAllahFromSatanRejected\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 1/206, At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/77, and Surat Al-Mu'minun, 23:98-9.\}
\{phrase:WhenVisitingTheSick2\} (sabaEFA mar~aAtFA)\{reference:At-Tirmithi, Abu Dawud. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/210 and Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/180.\}
\{reference:At-Tirmithi, Ibn Majah, Ahmad. See, Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/244, and Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/286. It was also graded authentic by Ahmad Shakir.\}
\{phrase:TheSickWhoHaveRenouncedAllHopeOfLife3\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/152 and Sahih Ibn Majah 2/317.\}
\{phrase:CreedOfIslamFirstPart\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 3/190. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/432.\}
\{phrase:ForTheDeceasedAtFuneralPrayer2\}\{reference:Ibn Majah 1/480, Ahmad 2/368. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251.\}
\{phrase:ForTheDeceasedAtFuneralPrayer3\}\{reference:Ibn Majah, Abu Dawud 3/211. See also Al Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/251.\}
\{phrase:ForTheDeceasedAtFuneralPrayer4\}\{reference:Al-Hakim 1/359 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him. See also Al-Albani, Ahkamul-Jana'iz, p. 125.\}
\{phrase:ForTheAdvancementOfRewardDuringTheFuneralPrayer1\}\{reference:Ibn Qudamah, Al-Mughni 3/416 and Ad-Duroosul-Muhimmah li-Aammatil-'Ummah, pg. 15, by Shaikh 'Abdul-'Aziz bin Baz.\}

\{phrase:PlacingTheDeceasedInTheGrave1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 3/314 with an authentic chain. Ahmad also recorded it with the wording: With the Name of Allah, and according to the religion of the Messenger of Allah. Its chain is also authentic.\}
\{phrase:AfterBuryingTheDeceased1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 3/315, and Al-Hakim 1/370 who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed.\}
\{phrase:VisitingTheGraves1\}\{reference:Muslim 2/671, Ibn Majah 1/494, the portion brackets is from Muslim 2/671.\}
\{phrase:PrayerSaidDuringAWindStorm1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/326, Ibn Majah 2/1228. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Mjjah 2/305.\}
\{phrase:UponHearingThunder1\}\{reference:Al-Muwatta' 2/992. It was graded authentic by Al-Albani as a statement of Abdullah bin Zubayr only.\}
\{phrase:ForRain1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 1/303. See also Al-Albani SahihAbu Dawud 1/216.\}
\{phrase:ForRain3\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 1/305. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/218.\}
\{phrase:UponSightingTheCrescentMoon1\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 5/504, Ad-Darimi 1/336. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/157.\}
\{phrase:UponBreakingFast1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/306 and others. See also Al- Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/209.\}

\{phrase:UponBreakingFast2\}\{reference:Ibn Majah 1/557 from a supplication of Abdullah bin 'Amr. Al-Hafidh graded it as good in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-'Athkdr. See Sharhul- Athkar 4/342.\}
\{phrase:UponBreakingFast3\}\{reference:Sunan Abi Dawud 2358. Al-Albani graded it weak.\}
\{phrase:InTheNameOfAllah\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 3/347, At-Tirmithi 4/288. See Al- Albani's Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/167.\}
\{phrase:BeforeEating2\}\{reference:Sunan Abi Dawud 3767, Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1858. Al-Albani and Darussalam graded it authentic.\}
\{phrase:BeforeEating3\}\{reference:Sunan Abi Dawud 3730. Al-Albani graded it as good.\}
\{phrase:UponCompletingTheMeal1\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi, Abu Dawud, and Ibn Majah. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/159.\}
\{phrase:WhenBreakingFastInSomeonesHome1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 3/367, Ibn Majah 1/556, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah 296-8. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/730.\}
\{phrase:ToADisbelieverWhenSneezes1\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 5/82, Ahmad 4/400, Abu Dawud 4/308. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/354.\}
\{phrase:ToTheNewlyWed1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah and At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 1/316.\}
\{phrase:GroomOnWeddingNightOrWhenBuyingAnimal1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/248 and Ibn Majah 1/617. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/324.\}
\{phrase:RemembranceAtSittingOrGathering1\}\{reference:Sahih Ibn Majah 2/321. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/153.\}

\{phrase:ForExpiationOfSinsAtTheConclusionOfSittingOrGathering1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmithi and An-Nasa'i. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/153. Aishah (RA) said: "Allah's Messenger (SAW) did not sit in a gathering, and did not recite the Qur'an, and did not perform any prayer without concluding by saying ... (then she quoted the above)." This was reported by An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah (no.308), and Dr. Farooq Hamadah graded it authentic in his checking of the same book, p. 273. See also Ahmad 6/77.\}
\{phrase:ReturningSupplicationForForgiveness1\}\{reference:Ahmad 5/82, and An-Nasa'i in 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah p. 218, with checking by Dr. Farooq Hamadah.\}
\{phrase:ToOneWhoDoesYouAFavor1\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi (no. 2035). See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/200 and Sahihul-Jami' (no. 6244).\}
\{18:1-10\}\{reference:Muslim 1/555, another version mentions the last ten 'Ayat, Muslim 1/556.\}
\{phrase:ToOneWhoPronouncesLoveForYouForAllahsSake1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/333. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/965.\}
\{phrase:ToTheDebtorWhenHisDebtIsSettled1\}\{reference:An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylahp. 300, Ibn Majah 2/809. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/55.\}
\{phrase:ForFearOfShirk1\}\{reference:Ahmad 4/403. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 3/233 and Sahihut-Targhib wat-Tarhib 1/19.\}
\{phrase:WhenSomeoneBlessesYou1\}\{reference:Ibn As-Sunni, p. 138, (no. 278). See also Ibn Al-Qayyim, Al-Wdbil As-Sayyib, p. 304, with checking by Basheer Muhammad ‘Uyoon.\}
\{phrase:WhenMountingAnAnimalOrAnyMeansOfTransport1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 3/34, At-Tirmithi 5/501. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi3/156.\}

\{phrase:UponEnteringATownOrVillage1\}\{reference:Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Tfaahabi agreed 2/100, and Ibn As-Sunni (no. 524). Al-Hafidh graded it good in his checking of Al-'Athkdr 5/154. Ibn Baz said in Tuhfatul-'Akhydr p. 37, that An-Nasa'i recorded it with a good chain of narration.\}
\{phrase:WhenEnteringTheMarket1\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 5/291, and Al-Hakim 1/538. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Ibn Majah 2/21 and Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/152.\}
\{phrase:InTheNameOfAllah\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/296. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/941.\}
\{phrase:OfTheTravelerForTheResident1\}\{reference:Ahmad 2/403, Ibn Majah 2/943. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 2/133.\}
\{phrase:OfTheResidentForTheTraveler1\}\{reference:Ahmad 2/7, At-Tirmithi 5/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/155.\}

\{phrase:OfTheTravelerAsDawnApproaches1\}\{reference:Muslim 4/2086, the meaning of sami'a saami'un (who listens has heard) is that 'a witness has witnessed our praise of Allah due to His blessings and favor upon us.' It could also be read samma'a saami'un, in which case it means 'one who has heard this statement of mine will convey it to another and he will say it as well.' This is due to the attention given to the Thikr (remembrance of Allah) and supplications made during the early morning hours. The meaning of his saying 'Our Lord, be with us and bestow Your favor upon us' is: 'Our Lord, protect us and guard us. Bless us with Your numerous bounties, and avert from us every evil.' See An-Nawawi, Sharh Sahih Muslim 17/39.\}
\{phrase:UponReceivingPleasingOrDispleasingNews1\}\{reference:Ibn As-Sunni, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic 1/499. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/201.\}
\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/218, Ahmad 2/367. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/383.\}
\{reference:At-Tirmithi 5/551 and others. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/177 and Sahihul-Jarai' As-Saghir 3/25.\}
\{reference:An-Nasa'i, Al-Hakim 2/421. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih An-Nasa'i 1/274.\}
\{reference:Abu Dawud (no. 2041). Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/383.\}
\{reference:Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/82 as a statement of the Companion 'Ammar (RA).\}
\{reference:Abu Dawud 4/327, Ahmad 3/306. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 3/961.\}

\{phrase:ForTheOneYouHaveInsulted1\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/171, Muslim 4/2007. The wording in Muslim's report is: 'make it a purification for him and a source of mercy.\}

\{phrase:WhenPraised1\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari, Al-'Adabul-Mufrad no. 761. See Al-Albani, Sahih Al-'Adabul-Mufrad (no. 585). The portion between brackets if from Al-Bayhaqi, Shu'ab Al-Iman 4/228, and comes another account.\}
\{phrase:AllahIsGreatest\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/476. See also 472. The 'something' that was referred to in this Hadith was a cane.\}
\{2:201:4-14\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/179, Ahmad 3/411, Al-Baghawi, Sharhus-Sunnah 7/128. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/354.\}
\{phrase:TheDayOfArafah1\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/184, and also Silsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah 4/6.\}
\{phrase:AllahIsGreatest\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/441. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/103, 235, Ahmad 5/218.\}
\{reference:Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmithi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 1/233, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 2/226.\}
\{reference:Ahmad 4/447, Ibn Majah, Malik. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/212. Also see Al-Arna'ut's checking of Ibn Al-Qayyim's Zadul-Ma'ad 4/170.\}

\{phrase:ToWardOffTheDeceptionOfTheObstinateDevils1\}\{reference:Ahmad 3/419, with an authentic chain of narration, and Ibn As-Sunni (no. 637). Al-Arna'ut, graded its chain authentic in his checking of Al-'Aqidah At-Tahawiyyah p. 133. See also Majma'uz-Zawa'id, 10/127.\}

\{phrase:SeekingForgivenessAndRepentance3\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/85, At-Tirmithi 5/569, and Al-Hakim who declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/511. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/182. See also Jami'ul-'Usool li-'Ahdaith Ar-Rasool 4/389-90 checked by Al-Arna'ut.\}
\{reference:At-Tirmithi, An-Nasa'i 1/279 and Al-Hakim. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/183, and Jdmi'ul-'Usool with Al-Arna'ut's checking 4/144.\}

\{reference:Muslim 4/2075. Ibn 'Athir explains that the Prophet (SAW) was always vigilant in his remembrance and drawing near to Allah, and if he forgot to do any of what he normally did from time to time, or it slipped his mind, he felt as if he had wronged himself and so he would begin to seek the forgiveness of Allah. See Jami'ul-'Usool 4/386.\}

\{phrase:ExcellenceOfRemembranceAndGlorificationOfAllah8\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 5/511, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed 1/501. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/531 and Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/160.\}

\{phrase:ExcellenceOfRemembranceAndGlorificationOfAllah11\}\{reference:Muslim 4/2072, Abu Dawud reports the same Hadith with the addition: and when the Arab left, the Prophet (SAW) said: "He has filled his hands with goodness." 1/220.\}

\{phrase:ExcellenceOfRemembranceAndGlorificationOfAllah12\}\{reference:Muslim 4/2073, and in one of Muslim's reports there is the addition: 'For these words combine [the goodness of] this world and the next.'\}

\{phrase:ExcellenceOfRemembranceAndGlorificationOfAllah13\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 5/462, Ibn Majah 2/1249, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Tbahabi agreed 1/503. See Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/362.\}

\{phrase:ExcellenceOfRemembranceAndGlorificationOfAllah14\}\{reference:Ahmad (no. 513) (Ahmad Shakir, ed.) and its chain of narration is authentic. See Majma'uz-Zawa'id 1/297. Ibn Hajar mentions it in Bulughul-Maram saying that Ibn Hibban and Al-Hakim considered it authentic.\}

\{phrase:AfterCallToPrayerFirstPart,AfterCallToPrayerSecondPart,AfterCallToPrayerThirdPart\}\{reference:Al-Bukhari 1/152, and the addition between brackets is from Al-Bayhaqi 1/410 with a good (Hasan) chain of narration. See 'Abdul-Azlz bin Baz's Tuhfatul-'Akhyar, pg. 38.\}
\{phrase:UponSightingTheCrescentMoon1\}\{reference:At-Tirmithi 5/504, Ad-Darimi 1/336. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/157.\}
\{phrase:UponBreakingFast1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/306 and others. See also Al- Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 4/209.\}

\{phrase:UponBreakingFast2\}\{reference:Ibn Majah 1/557 from a supplication of Abdullah bin 'Amr. Al-Hafidh graded it as good in his checking of An-Nawawi's Kitabul-'Athkdr. See Sharhul- Athkar 4/342.\}
\{phrase:UponBreakingFast3\}\{reference:Sunan Abi Dawud 2358. Al-Albani graded it weak.\}
\{phrase:WhenBreakingFastInSomeonesHome1\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 3/367, Ibn Majah 1/556, An-Nasa'i, 'Amalul-Yawm wal-Laylah 296-8. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih Abu Dawud 2/730.\}
\{phrase:Celebration1\}\{reference:See al-Musannaf by Abu Shaybah, 2/165-168; Irwa’ al-Ghaleel, 3/125\}
\{phrase:MayAllahAcceptFromUsAndFromYou\}\{reference:Al-Mahamiliyyat; Al-Asqalani graded it as good; see Fath ul Bari 2:446. See Majmoo al-Fataawaa (24/253).\}
\{phrase:InTheNameOfAllah\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 3/347, At-Tirmithi 4/288. See Al- Albani's Sahih At-Tirmithi 2/167.\}
\{phrase:BeforeEating2\}\{reference:Sunan Abi Dawud 3767, Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1858. Al-Albani and Darussalam graded it authentic.\}
\{phrase:BeforeEating3\}\{reference:Sunan Abi Dawud 3730. Al-Albani graded it as good.\}

\{phrase:SeekingForgivenessAndRepentance3\}\{reference:Abu Dawud 2/85, At-Tirmithi 5/569, and Al-Hakim who declared it authentic and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/511. Al-Albani graded it authentic in Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/182. See also Jami'ul-'Usool li-'Ahdaith Ar-Rasool 4/389-90 checked by Al-Arna'ut.\}
\{reference:At-Tirmithi, An-Nasa'i 1/279 and Al-Hakim. See also Al-Albani, Sahih At-Tirmithi 3/183, and Jdmi'ul-'Usool with Al-Arna'ut's checking 4/144.\}

\{reference:Muslim 4/2075. Ibn 'Athir explains that the Prophet (SAW) was always vigilant in his remembrance and drawing near to Allah, and if he forgot to do any of what he normally did from time to time, or it slipped his mind, he felt as if he had wronged himself and so he would begin to seek the forgiveness of Allah. See Jami'ul-'Usool 4/386.\}
\{phrase:Celebration1\}\{reference:See al-Musannaf by Abu Shaybah, 2/165-168; Irwa’ al-Ghaleel, 3/125\}
\{phrase:MayAllahAcceptFromUsAndFromYou\}\{reference:Al-Mahamiliyyat; Al-Asqalani graded it as good; see Fath ul Bari 2:446. See Majmoo al-Fataawaa (24/253).\}
